content.prompt: Which of the following best explains why bile salts cause the sulfur powder to sink?

choices.label: Bile salts decrease the surface tension of the urine sample.
Bile salts increase the water potential of the urine.
Bile salts increase the density of the urine sample.
Bile salts decrease the strength of the covalent bonds within a water molecule.

topic.text: 1.1: Structure of Water and Hydrogen Bonding

skill.text: 1.C: Explain biological concepts and processes in applied contexts.
